original: Dufwa, Torsten Wilhelm, häradshövding, fd. revisions’sekreterare, Högsby, f. 12/8/95 i Sthlm av kammarråd. Alfred D. o. Thyra Falk. G. 31 m. Elsa Ericsson. Barn: Göran f. 34, Ingela 36. — Studiex. i Sthlm 14, jur. kand. 20. Assess. i Göta hovr. 28, fiskal 30, tf. rev:sekr. 33, rev rsekr. 37, hovriråd 33-37 o. 40, här:hövd. i Aspelands o. Handbörds doms. sed. 41. Ordf. i iStyr. f. A-B Smål. Banks avd :-kont. sed. 41, kommifullm. RNO.
translated: Dufwa, Torsten Wilhelm, district judge, former audit secretary, from Högsby, born on August 12, 1895 in Stockholm to treasurer Alfred D. and Thyra Falk. Married in 1931 to Elsa Ericsson, with two children: Göran (born 1934) and Ingela (born 1936). He graduated from high school in Stockholm in 1914 and earned his law degree in 1920. He served as an assistant judge in Göta Court of Appeal in 1928, a prosecutor in 1930, acting secretary in 1933, audit secretary in 1937, a member of the royal court in 1933-1937 and 1940, and district judge in Aspelands and Handbörds courts since 1941. He was the chairman of the board of directors for the A-B Smål Banks' department office since 1941 and a commissioner for the RNO.
